definition: funny bits/humorous parts/jokes/punchline
old variant of 笑[xiao4]
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
amused by even the weakest joke/ready to laugh at the smallest thing

sentences.english: HHP is a popular online abbreviation for "haha point".
sentences.chinese: HHP是网络流行用语，表示“笑点”的意思。

sentences.english: The forehead, maxim robbed many scenes, mainly the punchline? In him.
sentences.chinese: 额，马克西姆抢了很多戏呢，主要笑点都在他身上。

sentences.english: He talked for 10 minutes and told only one knee-slapper during all that time.
sentences.chinese: 他讲了10分钟，笑点只有一处。

sentences.english: The well-placed and timed pause will help ensure that the audience hears the punchline.
sentences.chinese: 正确位置和正确时间的停顿帮助观众捕捉到笑点。

sentences.english: And sometimes, even after explanation, I just don't find it funny.
sentences.chinese: 而且有时他解释过了我也找不到笑点。

sentences.english: That's not because it's not funny. It's because I am probably a little too dumb to get it.
sentences.chinese: 因为我可能确实太笨了而根本领会不了笑点。

sentences.english: Even then, the magical pause can strengthen the punchline.
sentences.chinese: 即使，有魔力的停顿依然可以笑点。

definition: comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
the boring part of something (film, show, etc.) where a bathroom break can be taken
comicality/comical/(Buddhism) joy
to get people to laugh/funny/hilarious
entertaining/hilarious
amused by even the weakest joke/ready to laugh at the smallest thing
sense of humor
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to burst out laughing/hilarious/burst of laughter
(slang) silly but amusing person
comedy/CL:部[bu4],齣|出[chu1]
(Tw) to mention sth meant to be kept as a surprise/spoiler
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
(loanword) humor/humorous
(of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance
branch/stem/stalk/CL:根[gen1]/to block/to hinder/(Tw) interesting, fresh, or amusing subject matter or scenario
